Class ArrayMatrix<T>

java.lang.Object
com.end0katz.blobj.collections.grid.Matrix<T>
com.end0katz.blobj.collections.grid.ArrayMatrix<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of object in this matrix.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Grid<T>, Iterable<T>, Collection<T>, SequencedCollection<T>
public class ArrayMatrix<T> extends Matrix<T>
An ArrayMatrix is a Matrix (and, by extension, a Grid) with a backing array.
See Also:
  • getBackingArray()

  • Field Details

    • arr

      protected T[][] arr
      The array backing this matrix

  • Constructor Details

    • ArrayMatrix

      public ArrayMatrix(Grid<? extends T> from)
      Construct a matrix from another matrix.
      Parameters:
      from - the matrix to construct from.
      API Note:
      changes in this matrix will not be reflected in the other matrix and vice versa. If you want that, and the other matrix is array-backed with a method to get it, try new ArrayMatrix(yourMatrix.getBackingArray())

    • ArrayMatrix

      public ArrayMatrix(int width, int height)
      Construct a null-filled ArrayMatrix of specified dimensions.
      Parameters:
      width - the width of the matrix.
      height - the height of the matrix.

    • ArrayMatrix

      public ArrayMatrix(T[][] backedBy)
      Construct a new ArrayMatrix backed by an array. Each item in the array is a row.
      Parameters:
      backedBy - the array backing the matrix. changes in the array will be reflected in the matrix and vice versa.
      Throws:
      GridShapeException - if backedBy is not a rectangle.

  • Method Details

      Parameters:

      height - the height of the array.
      Returns:
      the array.

    • height

      public int height()
      Description copied from interface: Grid
      Return the height of this grid, or Integer.MAX_VALUE if exceeded. If the height cannot be determined, return 0.
      Returns:
      the height of this grid.
      See Also:
      • Grid.width()

    • width

      public int width()
      Description copied from interface: Grid
      Return the width of this grid, or Integer.MAX_VALUE if exceeded. If the width cannot be determined, return 0.
      Returns:
      the width of this grid.
      See Also:
      • Grid.height()

    • toNestedArray

      public Object[][] toNestedArray()
      Description copied from interface: Grid
      Return an array containing all the components in this grid in the form of: 
           Object[][] rows = myGrid.toNestedArray();
     Object[] row0 = rows[0];
     Object itemRow0Column1 = row0[1];

     // Or just itemRow0Column1 = rows[0][1]
      If this grid is array-backed, this array and their array should be separate. instead, a "getBackingArray" method should be created.
      Returns:
      an array containing all the components in this grid.

    • getBackingArray

      public T[][] getBackingArray()
      Return the underlying array. changes in the ArrayMatrix will be reflected in the array and vice versa.
      Returns:
      the backing array.

    • flipped

      public ArrayMatrix<T> flipped()
      Description copied from interface: Grid
      Reverse the order of the rows in this grid, in a clone. this.flipped().flipped() should equal this.
      Returns:
      this grid, with the rows reversed.

    • mirrored

      public ArrayMatrix<T> mirrored()
      Description copied from interface: Grid
      Reverse the order of the columns in this grid, into a clone. this.mirrored().mirrored() should equal this.
      Returns:
      this grid, with the columns reversed.

    • transposed

      public ArrayMatrix<T> transposed()
      Description copied from interface: Grid
      Swap the rows and columns in this grid, into a clone. this.transposed().height() should equal this.width() and vice versa. this.transposed().transposed() should equal this.
      Returns:
      this grid, transposed.

      public boolean hasItem(int row, int col)
      Description copied from interface: Grid
      Check if the grid has an item at (row, col). If row/col is beyond width/length, return false.
      Parameters:
      row - the row to check.
      col - the column to check.
      Returns:
      if there is an item at (row, col).
